lines.text: There's people who do good, Joey. They have... a family... a job... I had a job. Swabbed floors, made a livin'. I had a pension comin'.
I gotta go.
What I'm sayin' is... There are good people, Joey, and then there are people like me. Don't get caught on the wrong side of that equation.
[spanking Joe violently, making it personal]
You're just like your father.
You be a good boy, Joe.
While you're in the bathroom, put some toilet paper in there.
You do it. It's your jerk-off room.
I'll jerk your head off!
You listen to me.
[grabbing Joe's ear]
When I ask you to do something, you do it, right?
Right.
Make me chase you down the fucking street... If I ask you to march out on the street and jump up and down like G.I Joe, you do it, right?
Right!
If I ask you to go up on the roof and bark like a chicken, you do it, right?
Right!
I don't give a fuck whether it's your bosses, whatever it is, I'm your father and you do exactly what I say. Look at me! Right?
Right.
All right. What's for supper?
What do you need the money for? Christ, I coulda got you the money. What the fuck d'you need money for? You're thirteen fucking years old.
Fourteen
Well, you're not gonna see fifteen at this rate.
[seeing Joe eating scraps out of the sink]
Did you get something to eat?
Uh, just some Ho-Ho's.
Ho-ho's? Get a sandwich. Tell Roy to get you a sandwich, man.
No, it's all right. I'll just pick on this.
I wouldn't be touchin' that if you saw the leper who was drooling all over that shit.

[calling to the cook]
Hey, Roy, you old fuck!
What?
Get the boy a sandwich or somethin' before he gets hepatitis!
The old man went nuts.
What?
He broke all her records.
Love you.
You stink. I can smell your fucking shoes from here. I want you to take those, like I told you a thousand times before, and throw them in the fucking trash.
Why don't you buy me some new ones?
You're the big man. You're the workin' man.
Yeah, you know what I make?
Oh, why don't you tell me about it, big man, working man.
You don't wanna know.
Yeah, how much you take in tonight? Let me see your wallet. Come here.
Why? You wanna borrow some?
Are you through? Come on. You finished?
Every time I turn the corner it's "When's your old man gonna pay me?" and "Tell your old man I better get my money". Brazer, Jerry, and everyone else. You owe 'em, so pay 'em. Get 'em off MY back.
Thought I... told you to get rid of those shoes?
I'll get around to it.
So, you're gonna do some time. Stevie Wonder coulda seen that comin'.
I'll take a grilled cheese, Popeye.
You'll take squirrel.
